summary: This document appears to be a forwarded email or communication referencing a news article about the University of Michigan switching law firms due to their past representation of Jeffrey Epstein, Roman Polanski, and Robert Anderson. It is addressed to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a past client of a law firm that the University of Michigan decided to stop using.

persons.name: Roman Polanski
persons.context: Mentioned as a past client, alongside Epstein, of the law firm dropped by the University of Michigan.

persons.name: Robert Anderson
persons.context: Mentioned as a past client, alongside Epstein and Polanski, of the law firm dropped by the University of Michigan.

events.title: University of Michigan drops law firm
events.description: The University of Michigan switches law firms due to the firm's past representation of Jeffrey Epstein, Roman Polanski, and Robert Anderson.

keyFacts: The University of Michigan decided to stop using a specific law firm because of the firm's past clients.
The firm's past clients included Jeffrey Epstein, Roman Polanski, and Robert Anderson.
This information was reported in a news article from the Detroit News on March 7, 2020.
The document is a communication forwarded to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
